job_description: Tax Advisor Dell Technologies is a global, multi-billion-dollar corporation, so our Tax team has a huge task in ensuring that we meet our tax obligations. It’s a wide-ranging area – from tax research, planning and compliance, through to developing and implementing systems to support data collection, analysis, preparation and submission. Whether preparing and completing tax returns and reports, catching up with the latest developments in tax law or answering enquiries from a host of internal and external customers, we’re always switched on and on top of our game. Join us to do the best work of your career and make a profound social impact as a Tax Advisor on our Tax Team in Asia Pacific region. What you’ll achieve This Tax Advisor role is a critical role responsible for Dell Taiwan and Hong Kong’ tax portfolio management. The position requires sound local taxation knowledge, basic (tax) accounting knowledge and the ability to work effectively with external stakeholder (i.e., local tax authority) and internal cross-functional teams, driving the local tax compliance and resolving issues. The role will directly report to regional Tax Director. You will: Tax Compliance and Reporting: Prepare and manage timely and accurate preparation and submission of all tax returns. Manage accurate and timely US GAAP and local GAAP tax provisions, and relevant reporting standards such as ASC 740, FAS5 and IFRIC 23 etc. Oversee transfer pricing policies to ensure compliance and mitigate transfer pricing risks. Ensure full compliance with tax laws and regulations. Maintain records and documentation in accordance with local tax requirements. Tax Audits and Controversies Management: Manage tax audits, inquires, and disputes with tax authorities. Assist with the development and execution of strategies in resolve tax controversies in a timely and cost-effective manner. Stakeholder Communication and Collaboration: Collaborate with internal stakeholders, such as Finance, Legal, Treasury, Accounting and Business Units, to align tax strategies with business objectives. Assist with the education and communication of tax-related risks with internal stakeholders. Risk Management and Tax Research: Assist with enterprise-wide risk management approach, identifying and assessing potential tax risks for the legal entities in charge. Keep abreast of tax legislative changes. Take the first step towards your dream career Every Dell Technologies team member brings something unique to the table. Here’s what we are looking for with this role: Essential Requirements Strong data analytical skill and tax accounting knowledge. Effective communication skill in writing and in person. Sound Chinese tax technical knowledge with experience evaluating and advising on business initiatives, contemplated transactions, and business proposals. Self-motivated and self-starter who is equally comfortable with working in cross-functional teams and a good team player. Desirable Requirements 7 years+ working experience in tax field. Previous accounting firm experience and in-house experience in a multinational business Graduate degree in law, taxation, or accountancy, and/or Chartered Accountant (or equivalent) Who we are We believe that each of us has the power to make an impact. That’s why we put our team members at the center of everything we do. If you’re looking for an opportunity to grow your career with some of the best minds and most advanced tech in the industry, we’re looking for you. Dell Technologies is a unique family of businesses that helps individuals and organizations transform how they work, live and play. Join us to build a future that works for everyone because Progress Takes All of Us.
